did.unittitle: Roberts, George. The University of Kentucky: A Brief History, Its Organization and Its Function in the Commonwealth (2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: George Roberts was head of the Department of Agronomy in the College of Agriculture. President Frank McVey asked him to write a history of the University of Kentucky by rewriting an existing manuscript history. In his foreword, Roberts indicates that a large part of this history is taken from the biography of President James K. Patterson by Mabel Hardy Pollitt. Correspondence from Frank McVey to Roberts and from Roberts to Ezra Gillis (1935 January-May) is included in the bound volume.
